description: A serverConnectionLost trap signifies that the probe lost connection to the Boro server.

Summary.eval: ($v5 ne '') ? '$v5' : ($v3 eq 'cleared') ? 'Probe ($v4) connection problem cleared' : 'Probe ($v4) lost connection to the Boro server'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::serverConnectionLost ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::sequenceId c 9999 ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::referenceNumber c 9999 ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::status s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::probeName s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::messageError s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::beginTime s EXAMPLEE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::endTime s EXAMPLEE

description: Identification number of a message.
variables.name: ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::sequenceId

description: Reference number of a message used to connect messages referring to the error state occurrence and its completion.
variables.name: ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::referenceNumber

description: Error status. Possible values: active or cleared.
variables.name: ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::status

description: The name of the probe that the error pertains to.
variables.name: ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::probeName

description: Error message for serverConnectionLost notification.
variables.name: ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::messageError

description: Error start time.
variables.name: ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::beginTime

description: Error end time.
variables.name: ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::endTime

description: A stateChanged trap signifies that an event has started or has ended.

Summary.eval: ($v6 ne '') ? '$v6' : ($v3 eq 'active') ? 'Event state active' : 'Event state cleared'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::state ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::sequenceId c 9999 ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::referenceNumber c 9999 ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::status s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::probeName s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::taskName s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::errorName s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::level s EXAMPLE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::beginTime s EXAMPLEE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::endTime s EXAMPLEE ELECARD-BORO-TRAP-MIB::trapTime s EXAMPLEE
